greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n / gcd(n, binomial(n, floor(n/2))).
link: Hugo Pfoertner, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: For odd n, a(n) = 1. For even n, a(n) is either n/2 or smaller.
maple: swing := n -> n!/iquo(n,2)!^2: seq(n/igcd(n,swing(n)),n=1..92); # _Peter Luschny_, May 16 2013
mathematica: Flatten[Table[{1, n/GCD[n, Binomial[n, n/2]]}, {n, 2, 100, 2}]] (* _Alonso del Arte_, May 17 2013 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = n/gcd(n, binomial(n, n\2)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 22 2020
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Nov 13 2000
ext: Offset changed to 1 by _Peter Luschny_, May 16 2013
